Why two ccache lines instead of 1?  Can you add a comment to explain what / why these options are being used?

I suppose there is no real reason for having them in separate command invocation, other than the fact that they are logically separate actions. The `-M 1G` just sets the max cache size to 1GB (the default is 512MB, and just building the vm once puts the cache usage at 517MB)
This change doesn't belong in this PR.

What does `FindJava` do?  Is it something we authored?  

The root of my concern is that we want to be able to specify the Java being used to ensure it's the same bootjdk used by the rest of the build.

It is a built in module from cmake. you can point it to a specific java by setting `JAVA_HOME`
https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.4/module/FindJava.html
I think this should use the bootjdk as configured in the extension project rather than the default for the build machine.
I would rather this errors out than pick a random java

Ultimately, this is the same behavior that we have in the [makefiles](https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/01f3a1c977a8fc5b06de4b0dcc4b4745f1796e8b/runtime/buildtools.mk#L49), and in the openjdk [autoconf](https://github.com/ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk11/blob/d42cd0d94f7e017c1b3fbcb748cfecce81e15801/make/autoconf/boot-jdk.m4#L43)
This code is downstream from the openjdk autoconf.  We should never get here without having set the bootjdk

Actually @DanHeidinga there is a clear example of the check failing in https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/pull/2098. You can see the failure output (https://ci.eclipse.org/openj9/job/PullRequest-SignedOffByCheck-OpenJDK10/244/):

```
13:32:51 ###################################
[Pipeline] echo
13:32:55 FAILURE - The following commits appear to have an incorrect sign-off
[Pipeline] echo
13:33:02 commit afc2c20e928648a6277b2d17f5eebd01b2e75699
13:33:02 Author: Daniel Hong <daniel.hong@live.com>
13:33:02 Date:   Thu May 31 09:55:11 2018 -0400
13:33:02 
13:33:02     Re-enable toLowerCase/toUpperCase acceleration
13:33:02     
13:33:02     Modify API call so that caseConversionHelper recieves
13:33:02     underlying arrays and length of string.
13:33:02     
13:33:02     Closes: #1934
13:33:02     Signed-off-by: Daniel Hong <daniel.hong@live.com>
[Pipeline] echo
13:33:05 ###################################
```

So we do in fact need a new line between the "Closes" and "Signed-off-by" tags in the footer.
Note the PR referenced has since been fixed up but I've linked the failing job in the above comments. It's easily reproducible as well.
